brewery.brewery_description:
NL | Traditionele lambikbrouwerij en authentieke geuzestekerij. Meer dan 135 jaar ambacht, passie en kwaliteit. Koppig en puur. Levend erfgoed recht van de Zennevallei! 

EN | Traditional lambik brewery and authentic geuze blendery. More than 135 years of artisan, passion and quality. Stubborn and pure. Living heritage straight out the Senne Valley!

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston
3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 18|19) Blend No. 39
3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 18|19) Blend No. 48
3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 19|20) Blend No. 7

beer.beer_description:
A true Geuze. A blend of 1, 2, and 3 year-old lambic unfiltered and unpasteurized and aged in the bottle for at least 6 months after blending. Continued fermentation in the bottle give this Geuze its famous champagne-like spritziness. The lambic that goes into it is brewed only with 60% barley malt, 40% unmalted wheat, aged hops, and water, spontaneously fermented by wild yeasts, and matured in oak casks.

3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze is a blend of one-, two-, and three-year old lambics. Spontaneous fermentation, patient maturation in oak barrels, and continued evolution of the ecosystem in the bottle result in a distinctively complex and elegant natural beer. No two bottlings are alike, as there are multiple variables in the blending process, a variety of barrel sizes and shapes, differences in aged lambic proportions in the blend, etc. When cellared properly, 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze can be aged for several decades. The aromas and flavours will evolve from notes of vibrant fresh citrus, zesty and grassy notes to a mellow, oaky, stone fruit bouquet as the lambic continues to develop with time. Lambic and Geuze are living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley! Taste, savour, enjoy and experience this bottle fermented, unfiltered, unpasteurised and unadulterated beer with friends new and old!

bottling date: 03/05/2023

For this Oude Geuze, we blended lambikken of six different brews and five different barrels, of which three were freshly emptied Oloroso sherry barrels. More than 75% of the lambik has aged on such barrels. We used young lambik, more than 60% of two-year old lambik and almost 20% of four-year old lambik. This way, the weighted average age of this blend upon bottling is more than 27 months. Of the 3 Fonteinen lambikken (+80%), virtually all were brewed with local cereals from our cereal collective.

items.checkin_comment: Good morning, hope y‚Äôall slept wellüò¥ü•±

beer.beer_description:
A lambik straight from the oak barrel, unblended and flat. And that is normal...

Brewed on Tuesday 19th of November with winter pilsner malt and raw local wheat. We used hops from 1998 and 2007.

A brew day that started at 6am and was chilly throughout the day. At 4PM, we put the wort after a five-hour boil on the coolships. We lost about 40% of the liquid, also because of the cold evening and freezing night temperatures.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 165 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 34!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you‚Äôll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 95 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 20!

items.checkin_comment: Nice tart cherry even 4ish years on. Bracing sourness, but relatively full bodied, moderate funk. Really nice.

beer.beer_description:
bottling date: 23/09/20 ‚Ä¢ 37,5cl

This specific Oude Kriek Intens Rood has macerated for almost 10 months on five different lambics from two barrels. Another four different lambics from another two barrels were used in the blending process. The final fruit intensity was about 442 grams of sour cherries per litre of Intens Rood.
100% 3 Fonteinen.

NL 3 Fonteinen Intens Rood, als een krachtigere Kriek, is de trage maceratie van volle krieken op traditionele lambik. Zonder toegevoegde sappen, siropen of zoetstoffen. Ongefilterd. Ongepasteuriseerd.

FR 3 Fonteinen Intens Rood, comme une Kriek puissante, est la lente mac√©ration de griottes enti√®res dans du lambic traditionnel. Sans jus, sirops ou √©dulcorants ajout√©s. Non filtr√©. Non pasteuris√©.

EN 3 Fonteinen Intense Rood, a vigourous Kriek, is the slow and all-natural maceration of whole sour cherries on traditional lambic. No addition of juices, syrups or artificial sweeteners. Unfiltered. Unpasteurised.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 45 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 10!

You obviously are a big fan of Belgian Beer, and rightfully so! Three cheers to the great Belgian beers and their uniquely crafted flavors!

That's 10 different beers from Belgium. Try 5 more for Level 3.

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston
beer.beer_description: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston is a blend of one-, two-, and three-year old traditional lambics, all brewed at Brouwerij 3 Fonteinen. Spontaneous fermentation, patient maturation in oak barrels, and continued evolution in the bottle result in a distinctively complex beer. No two bottlings are alike, as there are multiple variables in the blending process, a variety of barrel sizes and shapes, differences in aged lambic proportions, etc. This cuv√©e, like all of our lambic, is 100% natural, authentic, spontaneously fermented, and crafted with steadfast adherence to tradition, like Armand and Gaston Debelder have always done it. This geuze has fermented in the bottle and will continue to develop its tastes and aromas over its long life when properly cellared. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley! Taste, savour, enjoy, and experience this unfiltered, unpasteurised, and unadulterated beer with friends new and old!

Bottling date: 27/01/22

For this Druif, we macerated muscaris grapes, picked at Hoenshof in the summer of 2021. We macerated the grape must on two- and three-year old lambikken. Maceration took almost four months before blending and bottling.

This brings the weighted average age of the blend to more than 22 months. The final fruit proportion is 396 grams of muscaris grapes per litre of Druif. Of all brews, more than a quarter was brewed with Pajottenland grown cereals. 100% 3 Fonteinen-brewed lambic.

NL 3 Fonteinen Druif is de maceratie van druiven(most) op / de co-fermentatie van druivensap of wijn met traditionele lambik. Zonder toegevoegde sappen, siropen of zoetstoffen. Ongefilterd. Ongepasteuriseerd.

FR 3 Fonteinen Druif est la mac√©ration de (mo√ªt de) raisins dans / la co-fermentation de jus de raisins ou vin avec du lambic traditionnel. Sans jus, sirops ou √©dulcorants ajout√©s. Non filtr√©. Non pasteuris√©.

EN 3 Fonteinen Druif maceration of grape (must) on / the co-fermentation of grape juice or wine with traditional lambic. No addition of juices, syrups or artificial sweeteners. Unfiltered. Unpasteurised.

items.badge_description: It‚Äôs been a long day and now it‚Äôs time for a reward. Crisp, tasty and refreshing, enjoy that delicious fruit beer! That's 495 different fruited beers. Try 5 more for Level 100!

You obviously are a big fan of Belgian Beer, and rightfully so! Three cheers to the great Belgian beers and their uniquely crafted flavors!

That's 215 different beers from Belgium. Try 5 more for Level 44.

beer.beer_description:
bottle date: 13/06/2023

For this Kweepeer, we macerated quinces for over six months on both two- and three-year-old lambik. We then blended with some very young lambik for continued bottle fermentation. Lambikken originate from five different barrels and seven different brews, brewed by both Lindemans (30%) and 3 Fonteinen. Of the cereals used in the 3 Fonteinen brews, a quarter was sourced from our own Pajottenland cereal collective. The weighted average age of the blend upon bottling was more than 40 months.

bottle date: 28/05/19

This specific Oude Geuze was blended with lambics originating from 5 different barrels and 4 different brews of which 67% brewed by us. For this blend, we used one and three-year old lambics only.

Deze specifieke Oude Geuze werd geassembleerd met lambikken van 5 verschillende tonnen en afkomstig van 4 verschillende brouwsels en waarvan 67% gebrouwen door ons. Voor deze assemblage gebruikten we enkel √©√©njarige en driejarige lambikken.


NL | 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze is een assemblage van √©√©n, twee,en drie-jarige traditionele lambikken, vergist op fles. Dankzij de spontane vergisting, de lange rijping op eikenhouten vaten, en de continue evolutie op fles ontstaat een uitgesproken complex en elegant natuurlijk bier. Lambik en Geuze zijn rijk levend erfgoed, eigen aan de Zennevallei! Ongefilterd en ongepasteuriseerd.

FR | 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze est un assemblage de lambics traditionnels d‚Äôun, deux et trois ans d‚Äô√¢ge, ferment√© en bouteille. Gr√¢ce √† la fermentation spontan√©e, la longue maturation en f√ªts de ch√™ne et l‚Äô√©volution continue dans la bouteille, une bi√®re naturelle, complexe et d‚Äôune √©l√©gance prononc√©e est cr√©√©e. Le Lambic et la Gueuze sont un h√©ritage riche et vivant, propre √† la vall√©e de la Senne! Non-filtr√© et non-pasteuris√©.

items.checkin_comment: Still drinking exceptionally well.   Tartness is coming up a little.  Lots of minerality, lemon, apple.   Beautiful

beer.beer_description:
Bottling date: 17/02/2011

3 Fonteinen Armand & Tomme (labeled as Armand & Tommy) is a geuze blended by Armand Debelder and Tomme Arthur of The Lost Abbey. It is a blend of four year old lambik matured from wort brewed at Boon and Armand's own lambic from 2008. It was released in 750ml bottles and is labeled as 6% ABV.

user.bio: Can't I live while I‚Äôm young

A greased mule is a happy mule!

beer.beer_description:
Bottling date: 17/02/2011

3 Fonteinen Armand & Tomme (labeled as Armand & Tommy) is a geuze blended by Armand Debelder and Tomme Arthur of The Lost Abbey. It is a blend of four year old lambik matured from wort brewed at Boon and Armand's own lambic from 2008. It was released in 750ml bottles and is labeled as 6% ABV.

bottling date: 25/10/2022

This particular Oude Geuze has been blended with lambikken from three different barrels
and five different brews. More than two thirds of the blend consist of three-year old
lambikken, bringing the weighted average upon bottling to over 26 months. Almost 60%
of the blend are 3 Fonteinen blended lambikken, of which more than 70% of the volume
was brewed with Pajot grown cereals. The lambikken typified as oxidative, with notes of
tangerine and grapefruit.

3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze is a blend of one-, two- and at least three-year old lambics.
Spontaneously fermented. Matured in oak barrels. Extended bottle ageing. Unfiltered. Unpasteurised

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 260 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 53!

items.badge_name: In With the Old, In With the New (Level 5)
items.badge_description: The debate between fresh and aged will be forever debated, but why not combine the two? A gueuze style beer is a blending of young and old lambics, which are bottled to undergo a second fermentation. That's 25 different beers with the style of Lambic - Gueuze. Try 5 more for Level 6!

Unlike most beers, lambics are fermented with wild yeast and bacteria, giving them a very distinctive flavor. We'll leave it to you to see how it pairs with fava beans. That's 60 different beers with the style of Lambic - Framboise, Lambic - Kriek, Lambic - Fruit, Lambic - Faro, Lambic - Gueuze or Lambic - Traditional. Try 5 more Level 13!

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 18|19) Blend No. 48
beer.beer_description:
bottling date: 01/03/2019

Deze  specifieke  Cuv√©e  Armand  &  Gaston  werd  geassembleerd  met  lambikken  uit  5  verschillende  vaten  en  is  afkomstig  van  9  verschillende  brouwsels.  De  oudste  lambik is vier jaar oud en werd gebrouwen begin 2015. 

NL | 3 Fonteinen Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston is een assemblage van jonge, halfoude en oude traditionele lambikken, gebrouwen door Brouwerij 3 Fonteinen. Honderd ten honderd natuurlijk en authentiek, spontaan en ietwat koppig,  maar  steeds  elegant  en  karaktervol.  Pure  passie,  zoals  Armand  en  Gaston Debelder het altijd hebben gedaan. Vergist in de fles en met een lang  bewaarpotentieel.  Ongefilterd  en  ongepasteuriseerd.  Een  echte  geuze met een mooie aroma- en smaakevolutie.

FR | 3 Fonteinen Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston est un assemblage de lambics traditionnels d‚Äôun, deux et  trois  ans  d‚Äô√¢ge,  brass√©s  par  Brouwerij  3  Fonteinen.  Cent  pour  cent  naturel,  authentique,  spontan√©  et  un  peu  t√™tu,  tout  en  restant  √©l√©gant  et  plein  de  caract√®re.  De  la  pure  passion,  comme  Armand  &  Gaston  Debelder  l‚Äôont  toujours  fait.  Fermentation  en  bouteille  avec  un  potentiel de longue conservation. Non-filtr√© et non-pasteuris√©. Une vraie gueuze avec une belle √©volution d‚Äôar√¥mes et de go√ªts.

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 19|20) Blend No. 7
beer.beer_description:
bottling date: 25/11/19

For this specific blend of Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston, we blended lambikken originating from seven different barrels and from eight different brews. Almost 40% of this blend are oude lambikken. The bottle aged for more than two years in our cellars before release, bringing the weighted average age of the blend up to more than 43 months. While blending, we added summer honey, harvested from our own bee hives.

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston (season 18|19) Blend No. 39
beer.beer_description:
bottling date: 14/02/2019 (St. Valentine's day and Michael's birthday!)

Deze  specifieke  Cuv√©e  Armand  &  Gaston  werd  gestoken  met  lambikken  afkomstig  uit  drie  verschillende  vaten  en is afkomstig van drie verschillende brouwsels. Dus elke ton een andere leeftijd. 45% halfoude en oude lambikken. Gemiddelde leeftijd bij bottelen was 20 maanden. 

This specific Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston was made with lambikken from three different barrels and comes from three different brews. So every ton has a different age. 45% semi-old and aged lambikken. Average bottling age was 20 months.

NL | 3 Fonteinen Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston is een assemblage van traditionele lambikken van √©√©n, twee en drie jaar oud en 100% gebrouwen door Brouwerij 3 Fonteinen. Vergist in de fles en met een lang bewaarpotentieel. Ongefilterd en ongepasteuriseerd.

FR | 3 Fonteinen Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston est un assemblage  de  lambics  traditionnels,  d‚Äôun,  deux  et  trois  ans  d‚Äô√¢ge,  brass√©s  par  Brouwerij  3  Fonteinen.  Fermentation  en  bouteille  avec  un  potentiel de longue conservation. Non-filtr√© et non-pasteuris√©.

items.checkin_comment: Very nice. Huge acidity. Nice cherry. Woody & spicy. Layered with subtle funk & organic aromas. This bottle was 100% flat upon opening despite a perfect cork.

user.bio:
Keeping the art, and the dream alive...
Ratings are based on style, as opposed to a hedonic system.

beer.beer_description: 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic. The kriek lambic is then blended again with more young lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 35% fruit, and is bottled immediately afterwards. These bottles are then stored in our cellars for at least five months so that the kriek lambic can develop into a beautiful, traditional, and refined Oude Kriek. With a pleasant tartness and organic notes of almond and cinnamon as it warms in the glass, 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek, will age perfectly but may lose some of the vibrant red colours and forest fruit aromas. This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley!

That's 15 different beers with the style of Lambic - Framboise, Lambic - Kriek, Lambic - Fruit, Lambic - Faro, Lambic - Gueuze or Lambic - Traditional. Try 5 more Level 4!

beer.beer_description:
A true Geuze. A blend of 1, 2, and 3 year-old lambic unfiltered and unpasteurized and aged in the bottle for at least 6 months after blending. Continued fermentation in the bottle give this Geuze its famous champagne-like spritziness. The lambic that goes into it is brewed only with 60% barley malt, 40% unmalted wheat, aged hops, and water, spontaneously fermented by wild yeasts, and matured in oak casks.

3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze is a blend of one-, two-, and three-year old lambics. Spontaneous fermentation, patient maturation in oak barrels, and continued evolution of the ecosystem in the bottle result in a distinctively complex and elegant natural beer. No two bottlings are alike, as there are multiple variables in the blending process, a variety of barrel sizes and shapes, differences in aged lambic proportions in the blend, etc. When cellared properly, 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze can be aged for several decades. The aromas and flavours will evolve from notes of vibrant fresh citrus, zesty and grassy notes to a mellow, oaky, stone fruit bouquet as the lambic continues to develop with time. Lambic and Geuze are living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley! Taste, savour, enjoy and experience this bottle fermented, unfiltered, unpasteurised and unadulterated beer with friends new and old!

3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic. The kriek lambic is then blended again with more young lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 35% fruit, and is bottled immediately afterwards. These bottles are then stored in our cellars for at least five months so that the kriek lambic can develop into a beautiful, traditional, and refined Oude Kriek. With a pleasant tartness and organic notes of almond and cinnamon as it warms in the glass, 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek, will age perfectly but may lose some of the vibrant red colours and forest fruit aromas. This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley!

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston
beer.beer_description: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuv√©e Armand & Gaston is a blend of one-, two-, and three-year old traditional lambics, all brewed at Brouwerij 3 Fonteinen. Spontaneous fermentation, patient maturation in oak barrels, and continued evolution in the bottle result in a distinctively complex beer. No two bottlings are alike, as there are multiple variables in the blending process, a variety of barrel sizes and shapes, differences in aged lambic proportions, etc. This cuv√©e, like all of our lambic, is 100% natural, authentic, spontaneously fermented, and crafted with steadfast adherence to tradition, like Armand and Gaston Debelder have always done it. This geuze has fermented in the bottle and will continue to develop its tastes and aromas over its long life when properly cellared. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley! Taste, savour, enjoy, and experience this unfiltered, unpasteurised, and unadulterated beer with friends new and old!

3 Fonteinen ‚ÄúIntens Rood‚Äù (Intense Red) is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries on lambic for at least six months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic, and is then blended again with more lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 450 grams of fruit per liter. The kriek lambic ferments in the bottle for at least another six months and develops into an intense wine-like fruit lambic. This bottle fermented, unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley!

3  Fonteinen  Oude  Geuze Golden  Blend  is  a  blend of  one-,  two-, three-and at least 25% four-year old lambics. Spontaneous fermentation,  patient maturation  in  oak  barrels, and continued evolution in the  bottle  result  in  a distinctively  complex  beer.

No two bottlings are alike, as there are multiple variables in the blending process, a variety of barrel sizes and shapes, differences in aged lambic proportions, etc. When cellared properly,  3 Fonteinen Golden Blend can  be aged for several decades. Traditional lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley! Bottle fermented, unfiltered and unpasteurised.

3 Fonteinen Hommage is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries and raspberries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of 760 to 800 grams of raspberries and 200 to 240 grams of sour cherries per litre of lambic. This fruit lambic is then blended again with more lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 35% fruit. Hommage is a bodied raspberry lambic beer, with an intense deep red forest fruit bouquet. This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added.

3 Fonteinen Schaarbeekse Kriek wordt bekomen door het macereren van lokale handgeplukte volle Schaarbeekse krieken op jonge traditionele lambik gedurende minstens √©√©n jaar, in een verhouding van √©√©n kilo per liter. De kriekenlambik wordt geassembleerd met jonge lambik en gebotteld waarna onze fameuze Schaarbeekse Kriek nog eens voor minstens √©√©n jaar verder rijpt in de fles. Verfijnd en met evolutie in het glas. Natuurlijk fruit, zonder toevoeging van sappen, siropen, of suikers. Ongefilterd en ongepasteuriseerd. 

3 Fonteinen Schaarbeekse Kriek is the result of macerating local hand-picked Schaarbeekse cherries on young traditional lambic for at least one year, in a proportion of one kilo of sour cherries per liter of lambic. The cherry lambic is then blended with young lambic and bottles, after which our famous Schaarbeekse Kriek matures for another year at least in the bottle. Refined and with evolution in the glass. Natural fruit, no juice, syrup or sugars added. Unfiltered and unpasteurised.

3 Fonteinen Framboos is the result of macerating hand-picked whole raspberries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic. The raspberry lambic is then blended again with more young lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 35% fruit, and is bottled immediately afterwards. These bottles are then stored in our cellars for at least five months so that the raspberry lambic can develop into a beautiful, traditional, and vibrant Framboos. With a abundant forest fruit nose as it warms in the glass, 3 Fonteinen Framboos will age perfectly but may lose some of the vibrant colours and forest fruit aromas. 

This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley!

3 Fonteinen (Oude) Kriekenlambik is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic (and possibly blended with some more young lambic). Fruit intensity ranges from minimum 35% to 50%. Aside some selected bars (e.g. 20th Anniversary of Akkurat in Stockholm, Sweden), this sour cherry lambic is available at given times in the lambik-O-droom

3 Fonteinen Oude Lambik is the result of a specific brewing process with a high proportion of unmalted wheat, spontaneous fermentation in an open coolship, and slow and complex fermentation and maturation in oak barrels of different sizes and shapes. This beer is completely flat as the carbonation evaporates through the wooden staves. 
Please note the age of the sample you are reviewing when entering your rating. 3 Fonteinen Oude Lambik is considered all 3 Fonteinen lambic above 18 months of oak barrel maturation after brewing, and every lambic blend served just prior to its bottling. It is poured locally around the brewery, in some selected places, and in the lambik-O-droom on dedicated hand pumps. As it is unfiltered and unpasteurised, the time between the oak barrel and the moment of serving is kept as short as possible.

This entry includes:
- all previous "vintages" of Oude Lambik
- the blends / "assemblages" of lambics ready to be / just bottled and that are poured in the lambik-O-droom or during events.

Served from a bottle, a lambic jug or from the hand pump.

As such, all future entries will be merged with this one as well.

With Brouwerij 3 Fonteinen, young unblended lambic is considered lambic with around 12 months of barrel conditioning up to 18 months. While Oude Lambik in the definition of 3 Fonteinen is at least 3 years old (to use in the blends), for the Untappd entries it is considered all lambics of at least 18 months old.

Served from a lambic jug or from the hand pump.

3 Fonteinen Faro is young lambic with candy sugar (classical faro) or reduced wort fresh off the first running of the mash kettle (traditional faro). Fresh faro is served fresh at given times in the lambik-O-droom or at events.

Served from a lambic jug or from the hand pump.

This bottle was presented to the Gold Ticket-holders of the Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2024.

bottling date: 11/07/2023

For this Oude Kirseb√¶r, we macerated stevnsb√¶r from the Frederiksdal Estate in Harpelunde, Denmark, on two-year old lambik. Maceration took over four months. We then blended with three- and a large portion of more-than-five-year-old lambik. The weighted average age of this sour cherry lambik clocks at more than 30 months on the moment of bottling. This blend consists of eleven different brews from 3 Fonteinen, Lindemans and De Troch. Of the 3 Fonteinen brews, about 90% of the grains were sourced in our own Cereal Collective.

3 Fonteinen Frambozenlambik is the fruit lambik coming off the maceration tank / barrel, possibly blended with young lambik, just prior to bottling.

Thie entry includes all fruit intensities, such as straight non-blended fruit lambic (+/- 80%) or blended with young lambic (35% and up).

Served from a lambic jug or from the hand pump.

NL 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Platinum Blend is een assemblage van √©√©n tot (minstens 25%) vierjarige traditionele lambikken, gebrouwen door 3 Fonteinen. Ongefilterd en ongepasteuriseerd.

FR 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Platinum Blend est un assemblage de lambikken traditionnels d‚Äôun jusqu‚Äôau (au moins 25%) de quatre ans d‚Äô√¢ge, brass√© par 3 Fonteinen. Non-filtr√© et non-pasteuris√©.

EN 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Platinum Blend is a blend of one- to at least 25% four-year-old traditional lambikken, brewed by 3 Fonteinen. Unfiltered and unpasteurized.

Lambik aged on freshly emptied old Amontillado sherry barrels (at least 40 years old).
Poured on several occasions and events, while emptying the barrels for bottling.

No panic... this beer has little to no carbonation - it‚Äôs normal!

Wijnbergperzikenlambik is het resultaat van de maceratie van minstens 5 maanden van rode wijnbergperziken op traditionele lambik.

Wijnbergperzikenlambik is the result of macerating red vineyard peaches for at least 5 months on traditional lambik. 

Served from a bottle, a lambik jug or from the hand pump.
No panic‚Ä¶ this beer has little to no carbonation ‚Äî it‚Äôs normal!

beer.beer_name: 3 Fonteinen Zenne D'Auge Two Barrel Calvados Lambik (season 23|24) Blend No. 16
beer.beer_description:
bottling date: 20/12/2023.

This second batch of Zenne d'Auge is a blend of two old Calvados cask matured lambikken.
These Calvados casks were sourced with the Domaine Familial Louis Dupont in Victot-Pontfol,
in the heart of Normandy. The history of this renowned cidrerie and calvados house goes back
for more than 150 years.
All lambikken originate from five different 3 Fonteinen brews and three different neutral barrels,
of which two four-year old lambikken were put on the Calvados casks for extended ageing. This Calvados lambik is the first testament of a wider blending of our two crafts. Meanwhile, the
team at Domaine Dupont also received a used sherry cask of ours at their premises to mature and finish an old Calvados on. The Calvados thus got that little 3 Fonteinen touch as well.

NL 3 Fonteinen Perzik is de trage maceratie van handgeplukte volle perziken op traditionele lambik. Zonder toegevoegde sappen, siropen of zoetstoffen. Ongefilterd. Ongepasteuriseerd.

FR 3 Fonteinen Perzik est la lente mac√©ration de p√™ches enti√®res, ceuillies √† main, dans du lambic traditionnel. Sans jus, sirops ou √©dulcorants ajout√©s. Non filtr√©. Non pasteuris√©.

EN 3 Fonteinen Perzik is the slow and all-natural maceration of hand-picked whole peaches on traditional lambic. No addition of juices, syrups or artificial sweeteners. Unfiltered. Unpasteurised.

3 Fonteinen Druif/Kriekenlambik wordt bekomen door een opeenvolgende maceratie van druiven en krieken op lambik.

3 Fonteinen Druif/Kriekenlambik is obtained by the successive maceration of grapes and cherries on lambik.

Served from a bottle, a lambik jug or from the hand pump.
No panic‚Ä¶ this beer has little to no carbonation ‚Äî it‚Äôs normal!

Weighted average 70 months

A true lambik! This lambik was taken straight from two foeders, both French oak barrels originating from the Barolo region. This is a 50/50 blend of both foeders. The first lambik came off foeder n‚Ä¢ 101 and was brewed on February 20th 2018 by Boon. The second lambik came off foeder n‚Ä¢ 106 and was brewed by Lindemans on the 30th of April 2019. 

At the moment of emptying the barrel, this blend of lambikken was almost five years and ten months old.

Pruimenlambik is de trage maceratie van handgeplukte volle (bak)pruimen op traditionele lambik. Zonder toegevoegde sappen, siropen of zoetstoffen. Ongefilterd. Ongepasteuriseerd.

Pruimenlambik is the slow and all-natural maceration of hand-picked whole plums or zwetschgen on traditional lambik. No addition of juices, syrups or artificial sweeteners. Unfiltered. Unpasteurised.

Served from a bottle, a lambik jug or from the hand pump.
No panic‚Ä¶ this beer has little to no carbonation ‚Äî it‚Äôs normal!
